If I am going to be real honest, the devs, known as BHVR, are actually a really shit dev team. It doesn't take much brain power to look at this game, play it and immediately realise that the devs don't really take care of it.

The game is HEAVILY imbalanced and is usually in favour of the survivors but that isn't the only problem. For me, the majority of the maps and their designs in this game are down-right awful and will have the common theme of being in favour of either the killer or survivors (mainly survivors). 

A common trait that you will see in good development teams, is that they actually play their own game and understand it quite well giving them the perspective of both high skilled and low skilled players. BHVR on the other hand just BARLEY plays their own game but they play at a very low skill level, so they don't also see from the perspective of higher skilled players which leads to completely unnecessary buffs and nerfs to killers and perks and horrible balance changes. 

 There is an up-coming game called VHS that is similar to Dead By Daylight but has something different, BETTER GAMEPLAY. The devs for VHS are actually really skilled at their own game therefore can actually make good, thought-out decisions that will benefit the game. Once VHS comes out, it will absolutely SMASH  Dead By Daylight into the ground and might even kill it for good with how BHVR takes care of it. 

I have tried to give BHVR a second chance to see if they can improve their game a lil more, and they started out pretty decent with the nerf of spirit, keys, and hatch which were absolutely game breaking. But of course, they had to fuck everything up again somehow, so i think they have lost their second chance from me. I think ill definitely quit Dead By Daylight once VHS comes out

Good Job BHVR, you managed to fuck over everything.

DBD has come along way since it's release and still has quit a bit to go. As survivor the game is fun, however as killer the survivors take trash talk to the next level. going as far as to go to live streams, steam accounts and even stalking the social media of the opponent to trash talk, harass or even in some cases threaten. The community as a whole can be toxic. There are wholesome people as well but they are few and far between. with the newest DLC around the corner devs will need to step up their game on the after match toxicity if they want to keep the new player base that is sure to come with the  RE DLC.

Glorified game of cops and robbers with both a relatively toxic community and an incredibly grind-heavy system that combine to create this incredibly awful new-player experience. But this is the Super Smash Bro's of horror where you can have Laurie Strode (Halloween), Heather Mason (Silent Hill 3), Ash Williams (Evil Dead), and Detective Tapp (Saw) face off against Freddy Kreuger (Nightmare on Elm's Street) in the Raccoon City Police Department (Resident Evil 2). Overall I would rate this game a 2/5: good time with friends if you do not take it too seriously.
